prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:

initial_story:
You are certainly no friend of mine. You have accused me of lying about what you had said, and run away when I proved by actual quotation that the accusation was false. We both know that, even though you praise humility, you are not humble enough to apologize.

 You sneered at my combat experience, saying "A lot of so called "combat veterans" of Vietnam smelled more perfume from call girls than they smelled cordite" and "So when you were an Army officer in Vietnam (even though you spent your time inside of Danang airbase, with at least two battalions of infantry marines on the wire ) what was the combat load for M-16 ammo per soldier on a daily patrol?" An actual friend would not have written such things.

No, you are no friend of mine, you ignorant, arrogant, hypocritical blow-hard. You should be able to guess that I do not feel friendly towards you
stories: You call yourself a mentor, but you're nothing but a self-serving critic. You've belittled my writing, claiming it's amateurish, and then had the audacity to plagiarize my ideas and pass them off as your own. We both know the truth, despite your feeble attempts to deny it. Your condescending tone, saying "anyone can write about their feelings, but it takes a real writer to craft a compelling narrative" still echoes in my mind. A true guide would have offered constructive feedback, not stolen my thunder. You're a hypocrite, masquerading as a literary guru, and I won't be fooled by your pretentious words.

You claim to be a visionary leader, but you're just a power-hungry manipulator. You've crushed my innovative ideas, labeling them as impractical, and then had the nerve to implement them as your own, taking credit for my hard work. We both know the reality, despite your pathetic attempts to distort it. Your patronizing smile, saying "anyone can dream up concepts, but it takes a real leader to execute them" still resonates in my memory. A true pioneer would have empowered their team, not hijacked their creativity. You're a charlatan, disguising yourself as a trailblazer, and I won't be blinded by your empty promises.

You masquerade as a benevolent mentor, but you're actually a ruthless opportunist. You've stolen my research, passing it off as your own, and then had the audacity to lecture me on the importance of "standing on the shoulders of giants." Your condescending tone, saying "it's not about who gets the credit, but about the greater good" still echoes in my mind. A genuine guide would have nurtured my growth, not plundered my discoveries. You're a counterfeit, camouflaging yourself as a champion of progress, and I won't be fooled by your hollow platitudes.

You pose as a selfless philanthropist, but beneath the façade lies a cunning manipulator. You've exploited my connections, using them to further your own interests, and then had the gall to preach to me about the value of "building a strong network." Your sugary words, saying "it's not about personal gain, but about lifting each other up" still grate on my nerves. A true benefactor would have empowered my community, not hijacked my relationships. You're an imposter, disguising yourself as a beacon of kindness, and I won't be swayed by your empty promises.

You masquerade as a devoted mentor, but beneath the veneer lies a ruthless opportunist. You've leveraged my ideas, using them to fuel your own ambitions, and then had the audacity to lecture me about the importance of "paying it forward." Your syrupy phrases, claiming "it's not about personal recognition, but about elevating the next generation" still leave a bitter taste. A genuine guide would have nurtured my growth, not co-opted my innovations. You're a charlatan, masquerading as a fountain of wisdom, and I won't be deceived by your hollow platitudes.

You pose as a selfless philanthropist, but beneath the facade of benevolence lies a cunning manipulator.
